intro: Stenandrium floridanum, commonly known as the Florida stenandrium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
